simpledb

Class BTreeLeafPage

  • java.lang.Object
    • simpledb.BTreePage
      • simpledb.BTreeLeafPage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Page

    public class BTreeLeafPage
extends BTreePage
    Each instance of BTreeLeafPage stores data for one page of a BTreeFile and implements the Page interface that is used by BufferPool.
    See Also:
    BTreeFile, BufferPool

    • Constructor Detail

      • BTreeLeafPage

        public BTreeLeafPage(BTreePageId id,
                     byte[] data,
                     int key)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Create a BTreeLeafPage from a set of bytes of data read from disk. The format of a BTreeLeafPage is a set of header bytes indicating the slots of the page that are in use, and some number of tuple slots, as well as some extra bytes for the parent and sibling pointers. Specifically, the number of tuples is equal to:

        floor((BufferPool.getPageSize()*8 - extra bytes*8) / (tuple size * 8 + 1))

        where tuple size is the size of tuples in this database table, which can be determined via Catalog.getTupleDesc(int). The number of 8-bit header words is equal to:

        ceiling(no. tuple slots / 8)

        Parameters:
        id - - the id of this page
        data - - the raw data of this page
        key - - the field which the index is keyed on
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        Database.getCatalog(), Catalog.getTupleDesc(int), BufferPool.getPageSize()

      • getPageData

        public byte[] getPageData()
        Generates a byte array representing the contents of this page. Used to serialize this page to disk.

        The invariant here is that it should be possible to pass the byte array generated by getPageData to the BTreeLeafPage constructor and have it produce an identical BTreeLeafPage object.

        Returns:
        A byte array corresponding to the bytes of this page.
        See Also:
        BTreeLeafPage(simpledb.BTreePageId, byte[], int)

      • deleteTuple

        public void deleteTuple(Tuple t)
                 throws DbException
        Delete the specified tuple from the page; the tuple should be updated to reflect that it is no longer stored on any page.
        Parameters:
        t - The tuple to delete
        Throws:
        DbException - if this tuple is not on this page, or tuple slot is already empty.

      • insertTuple

        public void insertTuple(Tuple t)
                 throws DbException
        Adds the specified tuple to the page such that all records remain in sorted order; the tuple should be updated to reflect that it is now stored on this page.
        Parameters:
        t - The tuple to add.
        Throws:
        DbException - if the page is full (no empty slots) or tupledesc is mismatch.

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<Tuple> iterator()
        Returns:
        an iterator over all tuples on this page (calling remove on this iterator throws an UnsupportedOperationException) (note that this iterator shouldn't return tuples in empty slots!)

      • reverseIterator

        public java.util.Iterator<Tuple> reverseIterator()
        Returns:
        a reverse iterator over all tuples on this page (calling remove on this iterator throws an UnsupportedOperationException) (note that this iterator shouldn't return tuples in empty slots!)
